captions.text:
Wow. '64
fender stratocaster
in classic white

With triple
single coil pickups
and a whammy bar.

I'd raise the bridge,
file down the nut,

And take the buzz
out of the low "e."

I know. I'll use
the "may I help you" riff.

I'd like to look at this
fender stratocaster, please.

Can I put
the fender back
now, please?

Not today,
my good man.
I'm feeling saucy.

I think
I'm going to buy it.

title: Wayne's World (5/10) Movie CLIP - Garth Likes to Play (1992) HD

comments.text:
Always liked Garth more than Wayne... The character is more original and is 
just more awesome :D I never got what was so special about that strat 
guitar though. It looks just lika a standard fender strat... What's so 
special about tripple single coil pickups and a whammy bar on a fender 
strat? They all have those :P Even before I played guitar I never got that.﻿

comments.author: ansiaaa

comments.text:
Its a play on the fact that some guitar stores in the UK do actually ban 
patrons from playing the song simply because so many people try to play it 
that employees have gotten sick of it. incidentally, the four notes mike 
plays don't sound much like the opening due to licensing restrictions. It 
is the real opening in the theatrical version of the movie but had to be 
changed for home video/tv.

looking at this as an adult and a musician...dana's definitely playing the 
drums here...of course, as a kid in 1992, it never really occurs to you

you assume that wayne is playing the guitar (he isn't...at least not what 
you hear) and garth is playing the drums...he is﻿

comments.author: Thrashmetal6666

comments.text:
+Thrashmetal6666 I agree. Great movie, but that part of her line is a 
clunker to someone with a little knowledge of guitars. It's no surprise at 
all to see a strat with triple single coil pickups and even a whammy bar. 
 It would be more surprising if you didn't.  The other part about "raising 
the bridge and filing down the nut" sounds a lot more authentic.
comments.author: Noyb Elohssa

comments.text:
Just saying that the statement is supposed to make her sound like an expert 
when it's almost all basic knowledge. It always bothered me because it 
sounded so scripted. That being said I love this movie.
